name: Hotel San Salvador

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very kind people and clean but....
reviews.title: not worth for the money

reviews.text: the room was very very small and't let your soap fall in the shower because you won't be able to take it again as there is no space.
reviews.title: LOCATION!
Amazing location, amazing service, perfect sleep!
reviews.text: Impossible to see the sky from the window: you can almost touch the wall of the neighbour house!
The walls are so thin that you may hear the conversations in the next rooms.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

reviews.text: Much too expensive for what we got. On top NO breakfast possibility at the hotel!
reviews.title: Great location, one minute walk from Rialto Bridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is really easy to find (not sure why some people have trouble finding it) and is in a perfect location for exploring the city. Don't eat at the restaurants next to the bridge. Ask the lovely ladies who run this place and go ANYWHERE they recommend. We did and couldn't have been happier. Make sure you book your restaurants before you go as they all get busy later and you can be refused without one. Rooms are small, which is to be expected but clean and comfortable. Just a heads up for anyone booking through expedia. they don't take the full amount and you have to pay when you leave the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the surface this hotel seems expensive for two star accommodation but compared with the rest of the hotels in central Venice it's an absolute bargain. The location is fantastic being only a 2 minute walk away from the Rialto bridge with St Mark's Square's is around a 7 minute walk away.
reviews.title: great location, great hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, comfortable and well equipped, including a hairdryer and in-room safe at no extra charge. The mini-bar is a nice touch. The size isn't massive but Venice is a cramped place and we felt there was plenty of room for the two of us in a double. The two girls on reception are the best thing about this hotel, very welcoming and friendly and always willing to offer advice on places to eat/visit as well as the tourist traps to avoid.
reviews.title: Great Location but hard to find

reviews.text: Overall this hotel is a great base for exploring Venice - clean, comfortable and well-priced with the personal touch.
reviews.title: Girl Travel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A tip for Venice - visit the quaint island of Burano, a peaceful haven away from the tourist madness of St Mark's
reviews.title: Good value, top location

reviews.text: For our Honeymoon, my wife and I stayed at Hotel San Salvadore in Venice. Conveniently located to Rialto Bridge, we were centrally located in Venice and found ourselves within walking distance of the entire city.
reviews.title: Great Location & Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful, although our room was small compared to what we were accustomed to in the U.S.
reviews.title: Great service but small, cramped and uncomfortable rooms

reviews.text: The hotel was hard to find initially. I knew we were nearby when we arrived in Campo San Salvadore, but having never been to Venice before, what I thought of as an alley is actually a street.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel in great location

reviews.text: A great little hotel in the heart of Venice. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Venice.
reviews.title: A hidden gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel San Salvador during a recent trip to Venice a few weeks ago. While we appreciated the genuine warmth and friendliness of the staff, our room was extremely small and cramped, to the point where I had to climb over the bed just to get to the other side of the room. The walls were also very thin so that we could clearly and definitively hear the conversations of not just the guests in the room next to ours but even guests several doors down the hall.
reviews.title: Great location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have previously reviewed the Hotel San Salvador and as we have stayed a further 3 times...and returning again in June, we wouldn't stay anywhere else. The service is second to non. Ambra and Stefania are two of the most lovely people you will meet both with sparking smiles and personalities to match.
reviews.title: We LOVE the Hotel San Salvador

reviews.text: The rooms are very clean and serviced daily, the decor is beautifully venetian and we LOVE the towels!! We now choose to stay in the Annex, in fact when we were in Venice getting married we booked all four rooms so we were able to have the annex to ourselves and is definitely an option likewise couples getting married in Venice should consider.
reviews.title: great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is very central and a two minute walk from the local super market which sells lovely bread, cheese and meat so why not make your own picnics up for the day rather than spending money at the more expensive restaurants 3 meals a day.
reviews.title: A little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our last visit was for our 1st wedding anniversary for the weekend, and we had the same super service that we have had on every previous visit.
reviews.title: Gem Near Rialto

reviews.text: in a cold, windy and raining day, with no hotel booking, Hotel san Salvador saved our day! the young lady at the reception ( I think her name is anna?) was very helpful and friendly, she helped us get settled and gave us all info needed. The rooms are tiny ! but very clean. Perfect when traveling on a budget but looking for friendly service and clean rooms
reviews.title: Two star budget heaven two minutes from Rialto

description: Hotel San Salvador is a small 2 stars hotel, located in a small alley 1 minute by feet from the Rialto Bridge. All rooms are quite small, but nicely decorated. San Marco Square is 5/10 minutes by feet.
